data.title: The Talented Ripley by Highsmith, First Edition
data.meta_description: The Talented Mr. Ripley. ; Source for Film / MOVIE starring Matt Damon and Gwyneth Paltrow by Highsmith, Patricia. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: As New. PHOTO Cover (illustrator). First Edition By This Publisher. 290 pages. " Highsmith's intriguing fictional character, Tom Ripley, an amoral young wastrel, who, when given the assignment of travelling to Italy to persuade a son and heir to return home, murders him instead and contrives to inherit his fortune." >>> Basis for the acclaimed 1960 Rene Clement film *Purple Noon* with Alain Delon, also seen in filmed by Anthony Minghella with Matt Damon, Gwyneth Paltrow, and Jude Law >> Nice unread copy. Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" Tall. Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. 1st. The complete screenplay of Anthony Minghella's new adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's THE TALENTED MR RIPLEY. Tom Ripley, a small-time con man, arrives in Italy from New York in search of a wealthy young man named Dickie Greenleaf. He has been sent by the young man's wealthy father to bring Dickie back to America. But once in Italy, Ripley becomes so attracted to Greenleaf and his exotic lifestyle in the seaport village of Mongibello that Tom yearns to inhabit Dickie's life and falls tragically in love with him. Dickie's wealth, style and good looks are qualities that Tom begins to covet. The frightening consequences of this attraction and the moral choices raised by the crime of murder lie at the heart of Minghella's absorbing film. Set throughout Italy (Ischia, Palermo, Rome, Tuscany and Venice), Minghella brings to life Highsmith's amoral tale of a criminal who gets away with murder.

Paperback. Condition: As New. This edition 1st published. Penguin Readers, 2001. This edition 1st published. As new paperback. This ed. 1st pub. retold by K. Hinkle. Tom Ripley is struggling to stay one step ahead of his creditors, and the law, when an unexpected acquaintance offers him a free trip to Europe and a chance to start again. But how does Ripley act when his new happiness is threatened?.

Softcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Press kit. Quarto. Illustrated cardstock folder holding the handbook of production information (stapled wrappers, 26pp.), the press release, and a printed paper envelope containing seven glossy black and white 8" x 10" captioned stills from the film. The contents are fine, the folder is near fine with modest wear and a bit of light sun on the spine. The film starts Matt Damon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jude Law, and Cat Blanchett. Based on the novel of the same name by Patricia Highsmith.

First Edition. Paperbound. Signed and inscribed by the author / screenwriter, Anthony Minghella: ÒFor John, with best wishes, Anthony Minghella.Ó Includes the complete screenplay for the film The Talented Mr. Ripley, written and directed by Anthony Minghella, starring Matt Damon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jude Law, and Cate Blanchett. With an introduction by Anthony Minghella. As new in printed wrappers. The darkly suspenseful story of a young manÕs desperate longing to escape the bitter mediocrity of his life, transforming it by any means necessary into conforming to what he perceives as the glamourous life of a privileged and handsome playboy. The film received many Oscar nominations, including Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material Previously Produced or Published (Anthony Minghella), Best Actor in a Supporting Role (Jude Law), Best Art Direction-Set De.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. 1973 (1955). First Issued in 1955. This edition was re-issued in a small quantity by William Heinemann in 1966 and then in 1973. This copy was printed in 1973 and stated as such on copyright page. In original DJ that has been price clipped. Book would grade nearly fine with exception of an indentation on the front of DJ that has left an impression on the front panel. Cloth has not been compromised but you can feel the indentation. Otherwise, panels / pages are bright and clean and appears unread. corners sharp. DJ is bright white with some minor rubbing. Better than it sounds. A very nice rare copy in DJ.

Highsmith, Patricia. THE TALENTED MR. RIPLEY Custom Clamshell Case Only. Coward-Mccann. New York: [1955, Book Date] Excellent Custom Clamshell Case [Not A Book] For The First Edition. Elegant Black LEATHER & fine YELLOW cloth, Custom Gilt-Stamped Titles to spine. Embossed [sculpted] design on the side inspired from the DJ's iconic design. Finished in rich Black velour on the interior. A superb & unique protective clamshell case for the first edition. A Handsome Collector's Custom Case for an important Collection. "Books definitely NOT included" When you place your order: Please confirm the actual size of your first edition as sizes may vary with age or if the edition is covered in Mylar. The text can be altered to add "signed" or other special requests. Generally over 100 in-stock titles. Custom Craft available upon request. Book definitely NOT included.

[Edgar-nominated Psychological Thriller] LEATHER-BOUND FIRST UK EDITION, first impression. Octavo (19 x 13cm), pp.[2] 265 [3]. Recently re-bound in red full calf, with raised bands, and gilt titles and decoration to spine. Top edge gilt, others lightly trimmed, with marbled endpapers, and the original cloth spine bound in at rear. A hint of spotting to edges, otherwise a crisp, clean copy in an attractive near leather binding. The first of five novels featuring the complex anti-hero Tom Ripley. Filmed in France under the title 'Plein Soleil' (Purple Noon) starring Alain Delon, and by Anthony Minghella, with Matt Damon in the lead role. Also the basis for the superb Amazon Prime noir series (2024) starring Andrew Scott.

Octavo, original black cloth stamped in green. First edition. The first of Highsmith's four books featuring Tom Ripley, a charming con man, thief and murderer, for whom "something always turned up." "Tom Ripley is one of the best of Highsmith's complex creations." - Pronzini and Muller, 1001 Midnights: The Aficionado's Guide to Mystery and Detective Fiction, p. 359. Basis for the 1999 film starring Matt Damon and Gwyneth Paltrow. Keating, Crime & Mystery: The 100 Best Books 52. A fine copy in very good dust jacket with a touch of fading to green background on spine panel and along a narrow vertical strip of the front panel near the spine fold and light wear to spine ends and corners, two short closed tears at top edge with mild associated creases and a 25x11 mm abrasion to spine panel restored by a professional paper conservator. The correct first printing jacket, priced $3.00 on the front flap. The jacket presents very well overall, and is much better than usually seen. (#151296).

Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. First edition, first printing. Bound in publisher's black cloth-affect boards with spine titles stamped in green. Good with soiling and slight lean to binding; moderate edge wear with bumped corners; remnants of effaced former owner's name on front free endpaper. In a Very Good unclipped dust jacket trimmed slightly short for the binding (an anomaly?), with fading to spine, light foxing, moderate edge wear; small tear to rear joint and damp stain to spine at verso.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good Plus. First American Edition. Nice copy of author's third book. Unmarked, tight and square. Black boards with light blue lettering on spine. Sharp tips. Blank endpapers. Price intact jacket ($3) has moderate wear at front fold with two tiny nicks. Tanned on spine to green portion but yellow and black fresh. Basis for excellent film that starred Matt Damon and Jude Law. Hard to find this nice. In mylar. Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

First edition. First edition. Author's third book. Some light offsetting to front and rear endpapers, else near fine, tight copy in dust jacket, lightly sunned on the spine and with light professional restoration to the spine ends and corners. Introduces Tom Ripley, an American ne'er-do-well who travels to Italy on an unusual assignment of larceny and murder. Filmed as PURPLE NOON with Alain Delon as Tom Ripley.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. Fine Copy In a Near Fine Jacket. First Edition $3.00 On Flap. Stamped Advance Copy. Also a Great Association Copy With Signed Book Plate Of Sidney Sheldon. Sheldon A Great Novelist And TV Producer In His Own Right.I Dream Of Jeannie, Hart To Hart and Other Great TV Shows. Noted His Great Books ThatIinclude Other Side Of Midnight. Excellent Fresh Copy Of This Mystery Classic. Comes In a Beautifully Made Slipcase. Association Copy.
